title: Catharia
text:
Catharia is a <a href="monotypic">monotypic</a> <a href="moth">moth</a> genus described by <a href="Julius%20Lederer%20%28entomologist%29">Julius Lederer</a> in 1863. It contains the single species Catharia pyrenaealis described by <a href="Philog%C3%A8ne%20Auguste%20Joseph%20Duponchel">Philogène Auguste Joseph Duponchel</a> in 1843. It is found in <a href="Central%20Europe">Central Europe</a>.
The genus, which was formerly placed in the disputed monotypic subfamily Cathariinae, is now placed in the subfamily <a href="Glaphyriinae">Glaphyriinae</a> according to a <a href="phylogenetics">pylogenetic</a> analysis based on gene data. Different authors treat "Catharia simplonialis" as either a valid species or a subspecies of "Catharia pyrenaealis".
The larvae of "C. pyrenaealis" are recorded to feed on the <a href="Caryophyllaceae">Caryophyllaceae</a> "<a href="Heliosperma%20alpestre">Heliosperma alpestre</a>".
